what: Groundwater analysis from 2016 in Kwale, Kenya
title: Groundwater analysis from 2016 in Kwale, Kenya
text: goal grdwtrsmpkwale provide datasets research planning water solid waste management Kwale, Kenya. package includes water anlaysis data collected 2016 combined geospatial data collection points. data collected part project UPGro (Unlocking Potential Groundwater Poor) aimed improve evidence understanding groundwater across Sub-Saharan Africa help tackle poverty.

title: Groundwater analysis from 2016 in Kwale, Kenya
text: can install development version ‘grdwtrsmpkwale’ GitHub : Alternatively, can download individual datasets CSV XLSX file table .

title: Groundwater analysis from 2016 in Kwale, Kenya
text: dataset contains results two sampling campaigns conducted Kwale County Kenya March June 2016 GHS/UPC part Gro GooD project.1 Water samples 79 groundwater 6 surface water (SW) locations analysed major ions, stable isotopes, selected trace constituents, electrical conductivity, nitrates, ammonia, pH, (Dissolved Oxygen), Eh (oxidation / reduction potential), Temperature, TOC (Total Organic Carbon) field alkalinity. locations sampled March (dry season) June (wet season).

title: Groundwater analysis from 2016 in Kwale, Kenya
text: data package two datasets: water_samples selected_samples.

title: Groundwater analysis from 2016 in Kwale, Kenya
text: dataset contains data analysis groundwater Kwale, Kenya. data collected March June 2016 sampling spot. total 157 samples taken 71 different localisations geospatial data included data package. sample analysis includes different measurements including conductivity, temperature, pH-values concentrations different elements/molecules groundwater samples. water_samples data set 80 variables 157 observations. overview variable names, see following table. Locations sampling spots

title: Groundwater analysis from 2016 in Kwale, Kenya
text: dataset contains data analysis groundwater Kwale, Kenya. data collected three weeks row 8 different locations. sample analysis includes measurements conductivity, temperature, pH-values concentrations different elements/molecules. selected_samples data set 69 variables 24 observations. overview variable names, see following table.

title: Groundwater analysis from 2016 in Kwale, Kenya
code: sf_samples <- water_samples |>    mutate(date = ymd(date)) |>    mutate(month = month(date), .after = date) |>    drop_na(month) |>    st_as_sf(coords = c("utm_x", "utm_y"), crs = 21037) |>   st_transform(crs = 4236)  tmap_mode("view")  tm_shape(sf_samples) +   tm_dots(col = "pH", size = 0.1, alpha = 0.7, palette = "RdBu") +   tm_facets(by = "month", as.layers = TRUE) +   tm_layout(panel.labels = c("March", "June"))

text: [1] Ferrer et al, “First step understand importance new deep aquifer pumping regime groundwater system developing country, Kwale, Kenya”, Geophysical Research Abstracts, Vol. 18, EGU2016-16969, 2016; Poster Avaiblable: https://upgro.files.wordpress.com/2015/09/egu16_groforgood_v1.pdf; UPC - Departement Civil Enginyering de la Universitat Politecnica de Catalunya GHS - Grupo de Hidrologia Subterranea
